ISSUE.TITLE: `man podman-run` shows different parameter name than the generated web man page (the underscore character is translated differently)
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION:
### Issue Description The file _/usr/share/man/man1/podman-run.1.gz_ contains: ``` The _from\fIuid\fP value is based ``` instead of the expected: ``` The \fIfrom_uid\fP value is based ``` Relevant markdown source: https://github.com/containers/podman/blob/94dba6d89137a45c89a296ce4e964596b283aa33/docs/source/markdown/options/uidmap.container.md?plain=1#L12 The generated [HTML version](https://docs.podman.io/en/latest/markdown/podman-run.1.html) of the man pages shows: The _from_uid_ value is based Generated HTML: ``` $ curl -s https://docs.podman.io/en/latest/markdown/podman-run.1.html | grep "value is based"

The from_uid value is based upon the user running the command, either rootful or rootless users.

COMMIT.MESSAGE: [CI:DOCS] uidmap man pages: fix corrupt italics The markdown-to-manpage sequence interprets _from_uid_ and *from_uid* differently. Use the latter syntax to get the expected result. Fixes: https://github.com/containers/podman/issues/19171 Signed-off-by: Erik Sjölund <erik.sjolund@gmail.com>
